page.title: 10Shopping in Dalgety Bay.
page.content: Until 1983 Dalgety Bay had only a small commercial centre comprising a Chinese takeaway, a butcher shop and a general store which sold almost everything including confectionery, soft drinks, tinned food, fresh fruit, magazines, newspapers and toys. Trade used to be very good until a new shopping centre was built to the west. Now trade is not so brisk. However, the butcher is the one shop in the commercial centre that has retained its regular customers because there is nowhere else in Dalgety Bay selling fresh meat and poultry. The shopping facilities in Dalgety Bay are inadequate for there are no shops selling clothes, babywear, footwear, furniture, electrical goods or materials for the DIY enthusiast. These goods can only be obtained by travelling to Kirkcaldy or Edinburgh.
